content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = Regex("^# Question\s+([^\n]+)", "m")
    answers = Regex("^# Answer\s+([^\n]+)", "m")
    question_regexes = [Regex("^# (?:Q|Question) \\d+\s+([^\n]+)", "m")] # For multiple questions with numbers
    answers_with_numbers = Regex("^# Answer \\d+\s+([^\n]+)", "m")
    
    questions_and_answers = Vector{Tuple{String, String}}()
    for line in eachline(md)
        if match(questions, line) !== nothing
            push!(questions_and_answers, (strip(match(questions, line).captures[1]), ""))
        elseif match(answers, line) !== nothing
            existing_qa = findfirst([q[:1] for q in questions_and_answers], strip(line))
            if existing_qa !== nothing
                questions_and_answers[existing_qa.start][2] += strip(match(answers, line).captures[1])
            end
        elseif match(question_regexes[1], line) !== nothing
            push!(questions_and_answers, (strip(match(question_regexes[1], line).captures[1]), ""))
        elseif match(answers_with_numbers, line) !== nothing
            existing_qa = findfirst([q[:1] for q in questions_and_answers], strip(line))
            if existing_qa !== nothing
                questions_and_answers[existing_qa.start][2] += strip(match(answers_with_numbers, line).captures[1])
            end
        else
            for (i, qa) in enumerate(questions_and_answers)
                if occursin(strip(line), strip(qa[2]))
                    qa[2] += "\n" * strip(line)
                    break
                end
            end
        end
    end
    
    return questions_and_answers
end
```
